dev.text1: This website was developed as part of the SYBIT Coding Camp 2025
dev.text2: by young talents who took their first steps in professional software development with curiosity, discipline and creativity.our goal was not just to write code, but to create something meaningful that works, is useful and makes our ideas visible.
dev.text3: Special thanks go to all participants who worked on this project with passion, team spirit and perseverance. Every component, every line of code and every decision behind it reflects the learning process and the commitment of everyone involved.
dev.patrticptantslist: Kaan Gel, Luisa Karsniqi, Sebastian Keller, Tomash Fedak, Leonard R√∂pcke, Jamal Blank, Adriano Mestre and Sasha (Oleksandr) Pavchak
dev.coacheslist: Felix Klein, Max Eichelmann, Yannik Deschler, Yannik Schwarz, Max Buhl, Elias Frank, Noel W√∂lfle and Stephan Strittmatter
dev.headline: üë®‚Äçüíª Our developers
dev.altpicture: Group photo of all participants of the coding camp
dev.coding-camp-text: The SYBIT Coding Camp has been held annually since 2015 in the first full week of the summer holidays as part of the Radolfzell holiday programme. Many former participants are now an integral part of the company and regularly attend the coding camp to be inspired and follow the current projects.
dev.sybit: SYBIT is Europe's leading full-service provider for customer experience (CX) with comprehensive expertise in business consulting, process consulting and solution consulting. As a strategic partner, SYBIT supports companies in designing customer-centric processes and implementing innovative solutions along the entire customer journey. With over 25 years of experience and as part of NTT Data Business Solutions, SYBIT is driving sustainable digital transformation. We create customer experience champions!
dev.coding-camp-title: SYBIT Coding Camp ‚Äì A Success Story

ACCESSIBILITY.TITLE: Accessibility statement
ACCESSIBILITY.INTRO: We aim to meet WCAG 2.1 AA / WCAG 2.2 AA, BITV 2.0 and ¬ß 10(1) L-BGG (Baden-W√ºrttemberg).
ACCESSIBILITY.STATEMENT_SCOPE: This statement applies to the Coding Camp 2025 web application.

LEGAL_BASIS.TITLE: Legal basis
LEGAL_BASIS.TEXT: The following standards and regulations apply:

POINTS.EU_DIRECTIVE: Directive (EU) 2016/2102 on the accessibility of the websites and mobile applications of public sector bodies
POINTS.WCAG: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 and 2.2, conformance level AA
POINTS.LBGG: Section 10 (1) of the State Equal Opportunities Act (L-BGG) Baden-W√ºrttemberg and the German Barrier-free Information Technology Ordinance (BITV 2.0)

STATUS.TITLE: Compliance status
STATUS.TEXT: This web application is partially compliant with the requirements listed above.

POINTS.SELF_ASSESSMENT: Assessment: self-evaluation using internal WCAG checklists (status: 26/11/2025).
POINTS.CONTINUOUS_IMPROVEMENT: Ongoing remediation and prioritisation of reported and identified issues in the product backlog.

NON_ACCESSIBLE.TITLE: Non-accessible content
NON_ACCESSIBLE.INTRO: The following content is not yet fully accessible:

ITEMS.ALT_TEXTS: Some images, graphics and icons still lack meaningful alternative text.
ITEMS.MAPS: Interactive maps and geodata are currently not fully accessible.
ITEMS.IFRAMES: Embedded external services (iFrames/links) may not be fully accessible beyond our control.

STATEMENT.TITLE: Creation of this statement
STATEMENT.METHOD: Method: self-assessment based on WCAG 2.1/2.2 AA, BITV 2.0 and L-BGG, complemented by manual reviews.

CONTACT.TITLE: Feedback and contact
CONTACT.INTRO: Report barriers or request accessible information. We respond within the deadline set out in ¬ß 8 sentence 1 L-BGG-DVO.
CONTACT.EMAIL_ARIA: Send an email to the press office of the City of Radolfzell

ENFORCEMENT.TITLE: Enforcement procedure
ENFORCEMENT.INTRO: If you do not receive a reply or are not satisfied, you may contact the following ombuds office:
ENFORCEMENT.BODY: State Commissioner for People with Disabilities
ENFORCEMENT.ORG: Ministry of Social Affairs, Health and Integration Baden-W√ºrttemberg
ENFORCEMENT.EMAIL_ARIA: Send an email to the State Commissioner for People with Disabilities
ENFORCEMENT.NOTE: Notice: There is a right of class action under ¬ß 12 (1) sentence 1 no. 4 L-BGG.
